front.p: 1873 October 21: to Hector Museum of New Zealand—Te Papa Tongarewa MU000094/002/0259

body.p: Yesterday I received a copy of your circular of the 13th. Inst., informing me of your being about to reprint the 1st. vol. of the “Transactions”, and requesting me to point out any errata I may have noticed in my contributions in that vol.

Speaking from memory I should say, that the “errata” (Printer’s & Editor’s) are very few; but what I wish particularly to know is, whether the great erratum (?) or omission of the “Notes” to the essay on the Maoris will now be printed w. this 2nd. Edition? If so, then I would mark the proper spots where the small reference figures to those notes should come in. Of course, you know how very much I regretted their being omitted,—however, that could not be helped. And, I suppose, you will recollect that, at your request, I made you a second clean copy of all those “Notes” some time ago, which Ms. I hope you have both safe and at hand.
Please let me know early about the printing of those Notes in this 2nd. Edn.
Hoping you are quite well—I am
